This COULD be great…..But it only allows you to do an activity three times before forcing you to select another activity again. So, if your child is on the letter writing activity, they can write three letters and that’s it and then it tells them to select another activity. You can select the same activity again, but you can’t just continue on without restating the activity. Why in the world would it do this? It prevents kids from being able to focus for more than 1-2 minutes at a time. My child immediately hated this after it made her pick an activity when she was focused and happily writing letters. Now she doesn’t use it.

Product Letters and black spots.We received the leapfrog device yesterday and I'm not understanding what's going on with the letters. It appears there are black spots or the paint is chipping. The device itself is working fine, however when the letters disappear it will be no use for learning. I've ordered 3 of these for my grandchildren ages 4 to 6, and to are artistic. We need the letters to stay visible. Thinking of cancelling pending shipping orders of the other 2 devices.
Touch screen does not work.Very cute learning toy. However the touch screen does not work, this ruined the appeal completely.

Can’t Add Every Name.The toy is fun and educational but one major complaint for us. My kiddos name contains three letters in succession that also spell a “bad word.” The tablet won’t allow you to type those letters even in the context of another word. This results in the name function not working because we aren’t able to enter the spelling of his name due to those three letters being in the middle of the name. I understand having a “filter” option to not enter certain words but not letting you type anything that even contains those letters is frustrating.

We also love the positive feedback at certain points it provides and the reinforcement.  Overall great purchase the children love it .
Great for kids.Perfect early learning tool

Great learnings tool with room for a couple of improvements.We’ve really enjoyed using the LeapFrog Mr. Pencil’s Scribble, Write and Read! I love that the pencil is connected in the middle, making it easy for both right and left-handed kids to use, super thoughtful design. The two volume levels are great for different settings, and being able to program up to three names is a fantastic feature. It’s helped my preschooler start learning how to spell and write his full name, which is a huge win.That said, I do wish there were more preprogrammed words for kids to practice spelling and pronunciation, it would really extend the product’s learning value. Also, the screen is tough to see in outdoor lighting, even on an overcast day under a shelter. A toggleable backlight would be a great addition.Overall, it’s a great educational toy with a lot of potential, just a couple tweaks away from perfect.

Great for fun. Don’t bank on it for teaching kids how to write properly.My toddler loves it. Saved us a lot of frustration on long drives. It also helped her get used to the letter shapes. She has hours of fun writing on it.It won’t teach them pencil grip and control though. I wouldn’t suggest this if you want to buy it for teaching kids how to write. This is like any other learning tablet, they can learn their letters and have fun with some drawing, but this should not be the primary tool teaching them how to write.

Great toy / learning tool.Kept my 5 yo occupied for a 2.5 hour car ride but is so annoying to hear as a parent in the drivers seat - especially when you realize you’re singing the songs to yourself at work the next week

Impossible to see, completely useless although nice concept.The screen is completely unviewable, first the screen is very reflective which makes it catch light and have high glare, second the contrast of the screen (black LCD over blue-lit background) is so poor that you cannot see anything anyways beyond some vague shapes, third the viewing angle is non-existent - if you move 1 degree up/left/down/right it also completely removes visibility.  Beyond this, the actual concept is nice with 2-in-1 laptop/tablet, children email writing, and songs, but there's not much here that you wouldn't find in almost any other children's toy (maybe like 30-40 permutations of songs/activities/etc) but since you can't see anything anyways, it's much more frustrating for the child than fun and you'll get alot of anger/crying with it.  Definitely DO NOT RECOMMEND.

Do NOT buy this sheet!!!!!!!.So look right…... I buy everything before hand.. and I’ve bought this mess on May 20th for my son’s bday on June 21st (keep reading). PARENTS BE AWARE OF MUSIC MODE.I have to write this review on my laptop however I am warning all parents of the music mode touch screen. As parents know children soak things up as a sponge soaks up water. They have big imaginations and tend to emulate what they see. I am big on a child remaining as a child and not being a raunchy adult. There is a clip in which I as a parent and most parents who actually care to raise their children properly would disagree with as being child friendly. In music mode as you are touching the music keys scout will dance and one of those dances involves shaking of the rump which is very inappropriate for a 2 year old a 3 4 5 6 7 8 9 10 etc. Thats not what a child should be engaged in and its a huge violation in my opinion. Yes its a great tool to help them learn but be vigilant because if not monitored could easily introduce vulgar and inapropriate movements in your child. Not surprising considering Netflix and cuties and now people trying to force children to make adult decisions at school..... Ima leave it there...

Customizable feature not on product that was shipped..The toy itself is great.However, the description of the product says that it is customizable in a way that you can connect to a computer and add the child’s name so that they can learn their own name on the leapfrog.This was one of that main reasons that I ordered it.The one that we received doesn’t have a USB connection so that feature that is advertised in the product description is not available.

Great toy, but fingers are easily caught in part that flips screen.I wanted to love this for my twins as they are always trying to type on my laptop, but they are constantly catching their fingers in the part that flips from laptop to iPad.

Kids Who Use Real Technology Will Have Zero Interest.My 4 year old sees me working on my laptop all of the time and she loves to mimic me. At 4 years old I'm not ready to buy her a laptop or even a chromebook yet. I though this would be a great way to allow her to play pretend while also learning with an interactive toy. The problem is, she had absolutely no interest in it. To be fair, she uses a Kindle Fire and has an old iPhone, which are obviously more advanced than this product. However, I thought the laptop style of it would at least pique and keep some of her interest. She literally played with it for five minutes and told me she didn't want it. Her 5 year old sister has a chromebook so she has no interest in it either. May be good for kids who are not used to modern devices but if your child is accustomed to any type of modern tablet/phone/etc. it is doubtful this product will hold their interest at all. It's difficult to use and a bit outdated.

Nothing compared to old version.Out of all the leapfrog products to buy, I would not buy this one. To be fair to the product, I must reveal most of my dissatisfaction is from comparing it to the old version of this toy. I bought the old version used, it came programmed with a name already, no big deal, had the usb to change to my little girls name, or so I thought. I plugged it into my computer and the software for this product, conveniently had been discountined. I was a little frustrated with that fact, but I saw they had made a new version and I was more than happy to spend any amount of money on it. My little girl loved the old version of this toy and I LOVED the personalization, it said your child’s name so many times, it even had emails that you could have personalized with your child’s name and 3 family members! It also had a song of your child’s name. Similar to the violet plush toy, but even more personalized. Now comes this piece of crap, you program your child’s name into it alright, once, you program it into the first letter of their name, when they press it it’ll say “that’s the first letter of your name” and spells it. It literally only spells it, it doesn’t even SAY it. Shame on you leapfrog, as a parent with a child with autism, who is constantly looking for ways to teach her to say her name, the old software/toy was going to be perfect. This “personalization” on this new toy is cheap and lazy and ridiclous.

Poor Product - 3-6mo of use.I loved this product and so did my kids.  LOVED IT!  My niece had an older version, so we got this updated one.  My niece throws hers around and it still works. Engaging & Educational, But a Battery Drainer.This children's computer is a very complete, entertaining, and educational toy for kids! It offers a wide range of activities that keep children engaged while learning, which we absolutely love as parents. It's truly a fantastic interactive tool.My main point for improvement would be the battery system. It consumes a lot of batteries very quickly, which becomes quite costly and inconvenient. An upgrade to USB charging would be spectacular, making it much more practical and eco-friendly in the long run.Overall, despite the battery issue, it's a highly recommended product for its educational value and the fun it provides. Just be prepared to stock up on batteries, or hope for a USB-chargeable version in the future!

Flip Screen is a nightmare for little ones and parents alike..As a mother of two kids with a three-year age gap, I've experienced many conflicts over toys, so I've learned that for the items my kids love, buy two. After my son received the LeapFrog Laptop as a Christmas gift a few years ago, I knew I would have to buy a second one for my daughter once she reached the appropriate age. However, I was not prepared for the updated flip-top screen. While the new screen is much brighter and more precise than the old model, the new flip feature never locks in one position, meaning the screen moves during gameplay. It frustrates my kids, and I'm honestly concerned about the device's longevity with a screen that can be on the top of the device as opposed to safely stored underneath a case/shell.

great design quickly outgrown.it works fine teaching abc and 123 it would have been better to do a qwerty keyboard 10/9/7 style goint 10/9/9 having the extra buttons for space and enter instead of having the space bar be enter i guess you can tell your kid has outgrown it when you start getting complaints about not being able to have a space bar to reply to the puppys messages  the k cowbell and x drum licks are phenomenal in the music area and one full octave using the numbers is great much better than a baby keyboard that only has 5 tones the 4x3 touch sensor grid is very visible so the illusion of actually having a normal touch anywhere screen is lost battery life is phenomenal 3 years on the stock heavy dutys alkalines would probably corrode before actually discharging  off/low/high is great so simple for loudness and you can go from low to high or high to low without it resettingif you save the twisting locking tabs from the box you can affix it to a play pen wall the handle seems redundant it has handgrips on the back and using the handle can allow the screen frame to flop openthe screen frame auto flipping seems almost magical

No querty.This computer is great. It’s durable and fun. However, the keys come in alphabet order and not querty. I understand the logic behind alphabet order, but all adult keyboards are querty and imo, it does a disservice to a child to not have it designed the way a real computer is.

Laptop screen keeps flipping.Great idea for babies who want to be big! Very responsive touch screen and full keyboard. BUT as others have mentioned, the screen keeps flipping in laptop mode. I had to add a piece of Velcro and ribbon to keep this from happening and still be used for both the tablet and laptop feature.

Reset spring for screen to flip properly.We are enjoying this toy. Was bummed when the screen wouldn’t stay put in laptop mode. Saw a video online that showed how to remove the 5 screws on the front and back of the screen and, with the screen facing upwards in tablet mode, reset the springs, replace the white cover and screw all the screws back in. This allows the screen to flip on its own and set itself in place when the toy is opened to laptop mode or tablet mode.Was worth the discounted price given I had to fix it upon receipt. Our child enjoys playing with this toy and I’d recommend it to children that enjoy letters and numbers. The touchscreen is pretty responsive and works well.

Had I known what I was buying, would I buy it again? No.

Fun little learning laptop for kids!.My kid really loves this laptop/tablet toy. The screen gets pretty bright, so it's best not to use it in the dark for too long, but it also means that it can be used while it's bright outside and they can still see it fine. The screen is decently sized, it's fine for what it's trying to teach kids, and it's pixelated screen graphics also have a good refresh rate. It's nice that it will say the letters when pressed, and in one of the modes it will also show an animal on screen, say what kind of animal it is, and play a sound. This is good for learning the letters and about learning different animals. The touchscreen aspect isn't used a lot, but for the couple games it has where you're meant to interact with something on the screen it's used well. There's some more "advanced" learning too, like where it asks to find a specific letter which is also nice to see. We like that it has 2 volume modes, however do note that it does not have a mute mode. I think the learning content on this is nice, and it's a good way to introduce younger kids to the alphabet in an engaging way.

Highly recommend.This little laptop has been such a great educational toy. My two year old sings her ABC's and counts to 20 thanks to this thing. It's great. Engaging for a busy two year old! 10/10 recommend.This toddler learning laptop / tablet has been such a fun and educational toy for my 2 year old! The size is perfect for small hands, and it’s lightweight enough for my toddler to carry around on their own. The buttons are colorful, engaging, and easy to press, and the sounds/music are upbeat without being too loud or annoying for parents. I love that it introduces letters, numbers, and fun phrases in a way that keeps my child entertained while learning. It feels sturdy and well-made, which is a huge plus since toddlers can be a little rough with their toys. Overall, it’s the perfect mix of playful and educational—my toddler feels like they have their own “real” laptop, and I feel great knowing they’re learning while playing. Highly recommend for any parent looking for an engaging educational toy!

My favorite kids toy by far!.This little laptop is a life saver! My son is obsessed with my laptop but since Ive gotten this one he does not touch mine. I can hear him repeat the sounds that scout is making and he is 21 months old with very little words. He stays entertained for a good while. We do not do a lot of TV and i prefer him not to be looking at a phone or iPad or any other electronic, so this feels a little safer, the screen isn't as bright and looks similar to some of the toys we had as kids. It flips around as an "iPad" and the screen is actually touch screen so that is pretty cool as well. The size of this is small enough to put in his little bag and he carries it around everywhere. The price on this is incredible and it will probably be my new gifts for all my friends with kids!

A great teaching interactive book..LeapFrog's Prep for Preschool Book is nicely made from dense plastics.  It feels well made and robust and has held up nicely to my 5-year-old son's abuse.  The book has plastic-like pages, that are touch sensitive.  The pages respond to fingers and / or the dry erase pen.My son has enjoyed using the book and it's helped his handwriting and letter forming.  He learned how to use the book quickly and has fun using it.  The dry erase pen is removed easily with a dry napkin.All in all... a great book.

Just use a different marker - trust me.My 3 year old loves this and we own about every laptop and tablet, sort of learning thing out there it seems.  This one is her favorite, she loves coloring and tracking the lines and says she's learning. She will sit and do this for a good 30-60 mins straight. Crazy I know, but she really likes it. Plus it's interactive it says the sounds of the letter you are tracing.Now if I could post a picture of her face that she decided to color when we weren't looking and she's never done this before, was completely blue and it was like half her face.  We washed, used dawn soap and it wasn't coming off.  We are like Oh well, lessoned learn and this pen is going in the trash.  Well, she took a bath a little later and it all came off, so that was a relief.  Just be warned, it's not easy to just wipe off or wash off in the sink, but it did ALL come off in the bath, so I guess it's washable?  I won't let her use this pen anymore because I don't want to go through that again, nor have to soak an outfit to get it to come out.Would I buy again or give as a gift - YES.

Great for preschoolers.This leap frog prep for preschool activity book comes with six different pages that are interactive. Some of the pages you write on with a dry erase marker and some of it you touch with your fingers. There are three modes-one is explore mode one is learn mode and the other is play mode.  You can use all those modes on each of the six pages. I really like that there are two different volume buttons so one is a little softer than the other. The dry erase marker that comes with this activity book is not my favorite. Once you write on the book it is very hard to get it off even right away. I wish they could have included a dry erase marker that you could erase right away or didn’t take a lot of water to rub off the ink. I tried two different other dry erase markers (from two different brands) on this book and I was able to wipe it off right away. I like the handle so my child has an easy way to carry it wherever he goes.

Extremely Disappointed! Inferior Quality, Short Warranty.I purchased the VTech Touch and Learn Activity Desk Deluxe from Amazon in September 2025, and I regret it. Initially, the product worked fine, but after the batteries ran out and I replaced them with new ones, the unit completely stopped working. Despite multiple attempts using fresh, high-quality batteries, the product remains non-functional.What frustrates me even more is VTech’s response. I contacted customer support, only to find out that their warranty lasts for just 90 days from the purchase date. To put that in perspective, other toy manufacturers offer 1-year warranties, which clearly shows that VTech doesn't stand behind the long-term durability of their products. This is a glaring issue that speaks volumes about the quality—or lack thereof—of their products.It’s unacceptable that a product, which is marketed as a durable and fun educational tool for children, can stop working so soon after the warranty expires. VTech is clearly not committed to customer satisfaction or product longevity, and this short warranty period only confirms my concerns about the overall reliability of their products.I highly do not recommend this product to anyone, especially if you're looking for a long-lasting, reliable toy. My experience with the VTech Touch and Learn Activity Desk Deluxe has been a major disappointment, and I am now left with a defective product and no recourse from the company.

Not working.Not working with battery. Tried everting I could and it didn’t play. I didn’t return it because I don’t want to Waite my time to find a box to cover it.

Fall Hazard.We bought this for my 2 year old grand daughter and the seat is small, even for her tiny bottom, and hard for her to sit on. She has fallen off of it several times. The hard plastic legs don't work well on a hard floor. They slide too easily so it is best to set it on carpet or a rug. The activity cards work well enough but, if she pushes too hard on a picture, as toddlers will do sometimes, the table will slide away from her. Again, hard floors don't work well with the slick plastic. The table and chair are just not very sturdy. Not a good purchase in my opinion.
Doesn't work.I purchased this for Christmas for my 2 year old and half the sheets did not work. I kept getting error messages. Waste of money and not worth returning.

Does not do much.I usually love Vtech products but this is lame. One of the buttons sticks, and it's brand new.  It's just not the quality of other Vtech products.
Wouldn’t buy.Not my toddlers favorite....almost too many buttons and overstimulating. The activity pages can easily come off and there’s no good place to store them.
Useless.He does not like it.

It's ok.This desk is ok. You don't get anything to write with on it. I wish the storage was better for the top sheets when not using them. The shelf needs to be a little longer. Also, the little buckets can only fit a few crayons or pencils, and they get caught by the lid when you open and close it, breaking the crayons in half. The kids had fun drawing on the activity cards with their markers, so I can't return the product, but I will not recommend to buy, and I will not buy again.
Cheap plastic..The body and the chair are made out of very cheap plastic. The legs all fall out. The chair is uncomfortable and too small for my two year old.

Wont repeat buying this.Cute item but the design is horrible my granddaughter can only play with this for about an hour before the batteries die, since buying this i have been keeping the battery companys in buisness

Hard for 2-year-olds to understand you can't pound on table.I'm not sure how long this product will last. My main reason for getting it was the art easel and the other brand I intended to buy was not recommended for a 2-year-old, so I decided to buy one that was.  When it arrived my husband and I played with the educational circuit board section for an hour.  We loved it, but when we gave it to our grandson, at 2, he doesn't understand you can't rest your palms on 4 letters at a time or bang on 6 instruments.  We'll see, but I suspect it's going to be an expensive easel.  Oh and I would never use chalk near that circuit board.
all parts did not work.numbers page did not work

Was great toy while it lasted (~5 months).I bought this as a birthday present for my son who turned 2 in Feb. He loved it and was eager to use it to learn. Sometime around the middle of the year, he stopped playing with it because it became glitchy. After a change of batteries, it was still glitchy. It seems the switch that toggles between music and activity mode isn't making proper contact and it rapid cycles between the two modes, announcing it every time it changes--very annoying, as you can imagine. The warranty was only for 3 months so no help from the manufacturer. Nearly 50 bucks spent for an item that now does not perform the primary function for which it was purchased. Glad I didn't buy any additional activity cards or cartridges for it.

Very sensitive to touch..I was hoping this table was great but it's just so sensitive to touch so if you are planning to use it for learning.. then good luck because even if you or ur child barely skim it.. it will go off and say everything! Not a good deal for toddlers or little kids..

Perfect gift to torment parents..Are you looking for a gift to torment parents but feel that a full drum set is too obvious?  Well do I have a gift idea for you.The volume control is on the front and to the full discretion of the children.  You might be surprised to learn that the volume down button is not very popular. And because the table is so positve and encouraging to the children, there is seemingly no end to the full volume incorrect responses.

not expandable.the desk comes with many activity sheets, but you can't use them without the "cartridge." vtech doesn't sell the cartridges. so really you can only do maybe 3 activities. the sound quality is poor.

it's great overall.I like the product it teaches a lot it sings and interacts with my son but I'm having a problem snapping the activity desk down it wont stay my son can take it off and carry it

Cute and works no problem.It’s cute but it frustrates my daughter. I wished she could actually use a pen to learn as they go. I wanted to return but I will give it a couple more days to see if my daughter grows to like it.

Better for children over 3 years..I was really excited to give this to my toddler, but even though he seems to be enjoying it, I’m frustrated by how finicky it is.For example, when he’s playing the search game for the alphabet and he has to find the letter S, if he doesn’t press exactly in the middle of the letter box, it either doesn’t do anything, or it thinks he’s pressing the letter beside or beneath S. I don’t like that he’s choosing the right letter and being told he got it wrong, it doesn’t seem like that’s going to help him learn.And I wish the phone part came away from the backboard like the letter writing part does. Because when he’s trying to play “phone a friend”, if he accidentally puts his hand on the board and touches a letter when he’s reaching over to touch the numbers on the keypad, it ends the “phone a friend” game and he has to start all over again.He’s only 2 yrs 9 months, so hopefully as he gets older he’ll be better able to avoid accidentally touching letters while using the phone toy, and he’ll be able to more precisely press the letters on the board so that they actually work.

SENSITIVE!!!.I will preface this by stating my son is only 18 months and this is for 2 and up (I believe). This desk is annoyingly sensitive to EVERY SINGLE TOUCH. Umm.Not sure if expansion bundle packs will be back in stock, if they are I will update my review but if not I wasted money for sure. Good BUT Also REALLY Bad!.I bought this for my daughter about 3 years ago along with Learn to Read expansion pack so if have it on hand when she was at the age and ready to start learning to read. She is 4 years old now and still plays with this table and the little chair is something she uses on a daily basis to either sit a the tabel with or mainly she uses it as a step stool to reach the sink to wash her hands or the counter to help me cook (use your own Judy as a parent as to whether your child can use this to stand on). While the table has always worked and my daughter still plays with it to this day and learned from it, there is a HUGE disappointment to it. The extra Expansion Pack I bought with it back when I first purchased the table about 3 years ago, it DOES NOT WORK!! 😡😡😡 I didn't think to check to see if it worked with and was comparable with the table back when I first bought it because IT SAYS IT WAS! So now I have a useless pack that my daughter should now be able to use and wants to so bad, but she can't because it's absolutely useless and not compatible with the table like it should be. Wish I could get my money back but it's obviously been way to long.
Buy if you don’t have choice..I like the concept but it very light and it doesn’t hold its ground on a wooden floor. It would be better if they add the rubber on the legs so it doesn’t move.

Touchy.My the year old loves it, but... It's VERY touchy. Think touch screen, touchy. Being a toddler she doesn't always have much patience and isn't perfectly coordinated so, example; she reaches to touch letter A and her forearm brushes against H, I, J, when she pulls her arm back, the table can't finish explaining what the letter A sounds like because now it's explain H,I,J all at the same time. This happens with almost every touch because again, she's three and doesn't lift her arm all the way up when she presses on it. I'd recommend it for 4/5 yr olds over 3/4 yr old.

Buttons are very sensitive and son presses all at once.I bought this for my 21 month old son. The sensor on the desk is very sensitive so my son just leans in to press the letter A B or C and the voice comes on and also says the letters his elbow or arm touches. This happens the entire time. I think the desk is very educational but more suited for an older kid who has patience and can press each button with one finger and wait for the voice to finish speaking and then press another letter. Right now my son just presses all the buttons and leans in and tries to touch the light screen that shows the letter and can’t wait for the voice to finish speaking. Hopefully he will grow out of this and be more patient and can sit and press each letter, one at a time. Other than the buttons being so sensitive to touch and speaking, this is a great learning tool!

Buttons are WAY too sensitive.I hoped to get this for my daughter so we could make it fun for her to learn. The features and functionality is great and she enjoys it but for all the wrong reasons.Don't get me wrong. I think this is a great little educational toy. But there is one issue I'm having with it that just turned it into a desk (for now). The issue is that it is very sensitive. Extremely slight pressure (think how sensitive a touch screen is) will set off any of the buttons.As a result it just sounds like an auctioneer with a child's voice in my living room just going off. She enjoys laughing at the crazy sounds that come out of it as a result but not in anyway educating her. We've just turned it off for the time being and will try again when she's a little more dexterous.

Slipping/falling hazard for little mats included.Although I love this item I will give it three stars because my daughter slipped twice already on one of the little mats. It’s such a great toy and it tells you when the battery is low. It would be great if it didn’t come with the little mats that go on the table because when my daughter dropped one on the floor she stepped on it and slipped on it. Luckily I was able to catch her once, she almost did the splits :( the other time I wasn’t near enough to catch her and she fell pretty bad. For the manufacturer making this, you should try not to add these as they are someone if a slipping hazard even to an adult if they step on it and slip.

Solid buy..We got one of these about 4 years ago for our son and we have given it as a gift about four times now.It makes a great gift, and for a later birthday or Christmas you can add to the gift by getting the larger deck of cards for it.The durability it great!! We have ours set up on the back of our couch and three of my boys use it to climb on and jump off of when playing on the couch and let me tell you this thing is a survivor! My boys did crack the front of the desk and it still works! However! I dislike how the legs come off so easily. Any time it’s move or picked up the legs come off. The stools legs stay in much better then the desk.The buttons are sensitive to touch like some people say but we don’t mind that because our one year gets to play with it and it’s easy for him to use it as well. All my kids have been able to play with it at a young age because of this.  So that’s a plus for me!My biggest complaint about the desk is that when buying the larger set of cards, you have to have the little chip cards for the desk card to work. If you don’t have the chip card, like you lose it (it’s like a cassette tape), the the cards you insert won’t work. So you’d have to buy the whole card set again.As far as packaging goes, the last time we ordered I ordered frustration free and it came in a plain brown cardboard box that had the title of the desk on it. Normally I wouldn’t care at all but we bought it as a birthday gift so the packaging made it not so appealing. But! Like I said if it was just for me I wouldn’t have cared but it wasn’t.

I will be looking for the expansion pack so he can learn more. I’m going to try the chalk and drawing part next!

Poorly Made - Terrible Customer Service From LeapFrog.I would give it 0 stars if possible. I purchased this for my 3 year old granddaughter for Christmas. I called them and a cracked screen voids the manufacturer’s warranty. 😳 They even put me on hold and checked with a Supervisor.  Seriously? Amazon told me it was covered. 🤷‍♀️ This product is recommended for 3-8 year olds; they are going to drop it. If the screen cracks that easily they need to make the product better.My recommendation is not to purchase this product because it is not make well enough to withstand a drop from a 3 year old. Leapfrog needs to honor their manufacturer’s warranty because I will never purchase another product they make - ever again.

Doesnt work after a few months don't but it.Bought this to gift my son in September and it no longer works. The thing can be plugged in saying it's charging but it's not charging. Don’t Buy!!!.I bought this thinking oh it’ll be so great will help my son with learning apps and educational games.Nope, it requires you to purchase all games from a leappad learn store all of the games being over $10-25+ this is such a hack/fraud. NOT WORTH THE HEADACHE.So, I originally bought this for a 12-hour road trip to Canada for my 3-year-old.I purchased this tablet thinking she would love it while also getting more benefits from the educational aspect. However, not even 30 minutes of usage, she was throwing tantrums due to the screen lag. At that point, she didn't bother to use it for the remainder of the trip. For this reason, I ended up returning it.During the setup, I decided to try the “90-day trial” for more apps as there isn't much offered without the additional subscription. Unfortunately, it was late at night and I mistakenly made an error while entering my email. After returning from my trip the subscription was supposedly cancelled, and the tablet was restored to the factory and returned. To my surprise, months later I’m still getting charged!?I reached out to Leapfrog customer service and no one could help due to the wrong email! I have provided the order #, phone number, the tablet’s serial #, card number that was being charged and still “they can't find any account with that information”. After multiple attempts at solving the issue with Leapfrog, I decided to go through my bank to dispute the charges. They kept $30 for the first charge, at this point I have up. At least I got back my other 4 charges of $30.Everything was fine until now. Apparently, I’m being charged again because I “resubscribed”. How is this even possible when I haven’t had the tablet for months!?

Internet connected money-hungry vessel for apps/subscriptions.This device needs apps and subscriptions. This is just a vessel for apps… not the leapfrog self-contained learning devices my kids have come to know and love. It’s connected to the internet and not a device I feel comfortable giving my young children. Not a good value for the cost.

I'm practically the only one who hates this thing.The graphics are old and outdated; just a not so nice looking screen.It's someone slow and you have to tap in weird places to get to certain screens. For a product ment for kids you would figure it would stand up to the provided soft point stylus. He had played with it for less that 3 hours and it's almost unusable.
Not much educational value.just simple games.

No!.First of all, all of the activities and game play require a leap frog subscription..2nd of all, I've tried to pay for the subscription so my daughter can play it using the same debit card I use for everything multiple times knowing I have plenty of money on it and it just says there is an unknown error so it's currently totally useless!!!

Glitchy and not worth the price!.These products glitched so much that all they did is frustrate my children! They aren’t able to spend much time with the games to actually learn because something was always freezing or not working. And I am not able to use them as a distraction when I need to get things done. Extremely disappointed!!
Volume.Only had it for a few months and the volume stopped working. My 1 year old uses it for her videos and activities I’m highly upset.
I’d Leave a Zero if I Could.Everything is a subscription based app. The tablet is using technology from like 2010. Hard for me to use let alone my 4 year old. Stay away at all costs.

TERRIBLE!!.Do not purchase this pad for your toddler it is terrible. I don't know what the problem is but it does not power on for long and takes FOREVER to charge! I could tell it was sent back because the box it came in appeared to have already be opened! It may be defective but was defiantly sold to me! I couldn't get a shipping label in time to get my money refunded back so I'm here to warn you .... DONT BUY IT! Get a regular tablet and just down load cocomelon, baby shark, and other learning apps for your kids with it because this isnt it! And dont get me started on the ridiculous subscription .... I'm paying for something my baby cant even use. When I finally got the tablet to come on I had to purchase more items for her to add on to play. Why? if I have a subscription it should cover it? Waste of money. Dont buy this!!

Not what I fully expected.Bought this for my 4 year old for christmas. Thought it would be a better option than the Amazon fire but I should have read it closer. Hardly comes with any apps and you have to pay for a yearly subscription for anything worth while. I just wanted to avoid her getting on YouTube and whatnot. Most likely going to return it and get the Amazon fire for her instead. This is pretty useless without spending additional money.
Requires subscription. Tablet lags.Has a lot of lag. Makes it hard to use. Also requires subscription.
Defective.Bought for Christmas present and Audio did not work out of the box! Had to return and reordered. Going to give it another try.

Unhappy customer.Product is good but terrible delivery. My daughter had to ride around looking for the product. The delivery person needs to be fired. They delivered three blocks away from the correct address

Get a screen protector ASAP before your kid starts using it!.Great tablet and son loves it! HOWEVER! I strongly advise against getting this tablet if your kid is clumsy. Once the screen cracks or breaks. No kind of warranty offered by Amazon nor the manufacturer itself can honor it. You’ll be out of $100! I purchased this tablet back in March and my son dropped it a week later and the screen broke. They couldn’t do anything. But because he loved it soo much I still decided to purchase a whole another tablet for $80 at Target! Rather insane these tablets are pricey but warranty is no good!
Not worth it.Daughter did like it. It doesn't do much with out paying each month for it. Her battery also drains like crazy now. She's annoyed with it and I would not buy again.

Amazing Concept / Tiny Lifespan.This was an amazing pad. Our 2-3 year old loved it. But a year later it won't charge anymore and is essentially dead. That seems like a really rough lifespan for some tech, especially since we only used it for long travel days.
Battery life.Battery life is too short. Slow response.
Not worth it for me. Stopped working in less than 1 year.I bought 2 of these for my twins, in less than 1 year one of the pads stopped working, and weren’t used often. It turns on but then shuts off.

LeapFrog LeapPad Academy Kids’ Learning Tablet.I’ve bought several other Leapfrog learning activity toys for my grandson.  Other devices have onlyBlack & White displays with VERY POOR resolution.  This has a larger, color display.  It is a great improvement over other products.  It also includes a rechargeable battery.  As all their products it can take punishment w/o breaking.  It includes some basic activities but a lot of activities requires additional payment for a fee.  Toddler should be at least 3 yrs old.  Can’t recommend as by the time a child can fully use you would be better off buying a used iPad or similar product.

Beware for younger kids.Far too fragile for the younger age range crowd. I was using my thumbnail and barely putting pressure to scrape some kid gunk off of the screen. We all know what that's like, and it cracked in three places. It won't work now. My daughter got this on Easter and she's only played with it. Maybe six times. She's only younger and so she doesn't get to play in discriminately, but it should be more robust than this for this price. I love the idea of the tablet that it's leapfrog learning products that you can download apps for them I like that much better for her than the Fire tablet but ultimately I would say spend the extra money and go for the fire tablet. The only reason it gets two stars is because it fit what I was looking for all except the quality.

No thank you.Just buy a regular kids kindle tablet. This wants you to pay basically $10 each for adding apps. It barely comes with any worth your time apps for your child. Returning and keeping the Kindle tablet i have.

Battery problems.I love this tablet for our baby girl but there’s a issue with the power. It keeps turning off. It’s charged and it’ll just turn off by itself. She loves the games and everything about it. We just got it for her for Christmas so I don’t know why it’s doing this

A product that must need warranty! Cracked screen in the frost 3 months of purchase!.I bought 3 for my kids and it’s overall expensive to buy the games they ask for and two of the three cracked their screens within the first 3 months. Very disappointing product apart from the constant freezing of the software.

Not worth it for a 5 year old.The durability and speed is lacking with this for a 5 year old boy.  Our son was successful in scratching the screen  within a few few hours of opening it.  Opening different apps takes about 20 seconds, and if you want attention span to last on the device, then this is not suitable for a 5 year old.
Screen is more fragile than a iphone.Screen shattered within a month. No protective screen was on it. The Kindle kids tablet is much more durable.

Wouldn’t recommend.The media could not be loaded.My son had an iPad but got this as a gift. I was excited because it would focus on learning and cut out all the extra stuff like Roblox. But he’s had it out of the box for 20 minutes and it’s already had multiple issues. It lags horribly but is up to date on the software, it freezes up and doesn’t recognize any touch & does that for a few minutes & now it’s stuck on a blank settings screen because we are trying to hook it up to WiFi. Save your money and go with a better tablet.

Two purchases in less than a year and half: Charging doesn't last over a year.We purchased the first one (Walmart) June 2023 while moving states. Within 4 months, we noticed it needed charged more than when first bought. The port seem to not hold the cord well as began to "wiggle" when plugged in. Also noticed the lagging in the apps and seem to slow down in response time. By November 2023, it would not charge.Purchased again (Amazon) December 2023. Within 6 months, noticed lagging again and needed more charge time even though he was on it less.  As of December into Jan 2025 (a year later), the port, again, has failed as well.Only adults are allowed to charge it. No damage etc. Two purchases with the same end results. I have found other on-line reviews, and school community reviews with similar issues.We will not re-purchase.

The device works.The device is in working order but the seal was broken on the box and the 3 months free trial card was not in the box. I had to create an account and add a credit card for a plan. 1 month free trial.

It's okay.Look, it is a durable tablet don't get me wrong, but the stylus is a fabric tip that most kids will either rip or chew off, which then easily scratches the screen. We've had two, and after about a year the same problem pokes it's ugly head, horrible load times and unbearable lag. Do yourself a favor though, you're really only going for the learning academy, which is just a browser based portal, meaning you can literally load it on any device, I've even had it running on a fire stick with Bluetooth m+k. I was genuinely shocked at how much smoother it ran. Oh, and the battery life becomes horrendous after a few months, sometimes even shutting down at about 20%

Kept my 2.5 year old entertained for 2 minutes.I was looking for something fun for my 2.5 year old! This device only kept him busy for 2 minutes. It's probably better for kids around 5 years old. Will be returning

Not suitable outside US.I live outside the US and it was a waste of money. My cart won't work without PayPal because of being outside country. I bought the leapfrog cards from Amazon which went on my account but they didn't let me use them because of being outside of US which sucked. So one my wallets has funds on it but I can't use it. The set up was easy enough but if you are outside the USA do not waste your money.
Package already opened.Pretty simple. Package was clearly already opened.

I recommend a tablet.I was between this and tablet. I recommend a tablet. My little guy wasn’t a fan and just wants to do learning games on my iPad. The games are not included and are &10-15 and I didn’t find them any better than learning games to can download on a tablet or iPad.

Good concept poor software.The media could not be loaded.This was such a great idea but the internal software is so slow and the apps don’t down load. Too slow in pace for my son who is 4. He was crying that he wants something else. Spent 120 in apps before relaxing the poor software. Kept losing WiFi connection while everything around me remained on WiFi. Very annoying to have. Returning today
No room to get learning apps..Restrictive and need purchase. Please consider adding android playstore with parentals
Confusing for little kids.This product is confusing and the kids have already stopped using it.
No computer.The parents hated it. No computers for their children

Battery Issues/Power Issues.Bought for my daughter for christmas. The tablet and program itself we love. The issue is the battery/power Issues. Haven't even had it a full month and we are going on our THIRD tablet. I've had to return two due to them not turning on or charging after dying. We plugged it in last night after it died, it was charging, woke up this morning and it won't budge. Just got it as a replacement for the first one yesterday. Same thing happened to the last one, but after a couple weeks. I also noticed things changed from the first tablet to the second we got, stylus is different, different charger. Which shows me they're fixing "issues" already. Too bad they didn't fix the battery. Contacted Leapfrog originally and they told me to just return it and get a replacement where I bought it. Ended up having to pay more because Amazon didn't offer a replacement so I just returned and rebought. Getting sick of having to set up the new tablets all over again and dropping off the broken ones at UPS.

Nice at first, but doesn’t last..The tablet isn’t the most intuitive to figure out to begin with, but it got a bit better until about two months ago. A year after purchase, the tablet won’t connect to Wi-Fi at all, we’ve done a complete reset on it twice, and it still won’t work. Our son is heartbroken, and it’s a bummer we wasted money on something that didn’t last very long.
The screen will shatter and can't be replaced.The screen shattered and cannot be replaced it fell from the bedside ...so it's not a non shatter screen just over a year

Good brand but hard to reach customer service.Bought 2 of these in November of 2022 as Christmas gifts at the end of that year for my kids. After using one of the 2 and the battery running out, we attempted to charge it and it wouldn't charge. I've tried reaching out to leappad and recieved no help. I tried reaching out to Amazon and they told me to contact leap pad. So now I have one that my child hasn't been able to play since Christmas and no help in getting what happened to it fixed. It's to the point that no one has tried to help me resolve the issue that now I have to pay more money for a place to help me fix it. I should of never had to do that in the first place

Beware - they break fast.My kids love these. Which is why I am so frustrated. We’ve been through several and every time they stop charging consistently (or at all) and then even if you manage to charge it - they start losing power very rapidly (less than an hour) despite showing fully charged at first. If you get them as a gift, they won’t help at all without a receipt. I’m bummed the customer service and lifetime isn’t better bc the kids really like the games.
Sent it back.Bought for 3 year old. Sent it back and bought ABC mouse instead.

Not what I expected.Bought this for my daughters birthday and unfortunately she didn’t like it. It wasn’t what I expected. The games weren’t fun for her and she had trouble navigating it. We decided to send it back.

Randomly restarts.Got the tablet and at first it was good.. Then after a few weeks it won't hold a good charge and now has started randomly restarting.. Power button is not sticky it just restarts at random points.

Stopped working after 7 months!!!!.Update: After 7 months, my 5 year olds leappad academy completely stopped working and would not turn on. After 8 months, my 6 year olds stopped working and will not turn on.Very disappointed that there is not an option to get a new battery for these.Purchase at your own risk!Gave these to my 4 and 5 year olds for christmas and they worked fine for a couple weeks. Now they take over 6 hours to charge and don't fully charge to 100%.Very disappointed in them and I am not going to be purchasing again.

Doesn’t connect to internet. Customer service said it’s just faulty and happens to some of them..This leap pad has never connected to the Internet even though we’ve tried many many times when we called customer service, they told us that it was faulty, and there was nothing they can do about it.  Did offer us free games and stuff that we can download.But not a refund not an exchange nothing to do with the tablet and of course I couldn’t download any games that hooked up to the Internet.  I highly do not recommend this tablet by any means. I was a big leap frog fan up until this point, and now I will not be returning.  If I can.

Garbage.Bought this for my 3yr old son for Christmas. Just a little over a month of minimal use it has started glinting and the pen doesn't respond. Called Amazon for an exchange or return and they said it is 1 day past the return window. Buyer beware.
Sending back.To confusing to set up, bought for my 4 year old grandson. Back it goes.

Boxes were damaged, and one had been opened.I purchased 2 for Christmas gifts. They both arrived with crushed boxes, and one looked like it had been riffled through.  These do not fit the definition of “New”. Christmas is the day after next, so disappointing.
Function inconsistent.Super disappointed 😞 this product glitches regularly and does not hold charge. I was thinking it could be user error however it isn't.  Will be sending back shortly.
Wouldn’t buy again.I got 2 and it doesn’t connect to wi-Fi
Won’t charge upset child.I can’t get the pad to charge so disappointing because it’s not been used much at all. Had it for 5 months and my son just started using it two weeks ago.

Waste of money.We purchased this for my step sons 3rd bday. It is not user friendly. It comes with some apps already and I thought would be plenty. It is not. You have to have a subscription. Honestly, save your money and by a tablet or Amazon fire. It's way more cost effective and there are free learning apps. Then you can put parent lock on it to keep them from going to other things.

Slow and Unresponsive.Obviously we purchased this item for educational purposes. The tablet seemed to have so much potential. It is impossible for our child to run any of the programs. Either they don't load, or the whole thing just freezes, which is pretty disappointing considering the academy portion of the tablet is a subscription based service, and it doesn't work 75% of the time. Not only is it frustrating for us parents, but our child has basically lost all interest because of how poorly it runs.
Low battery lifetime.Felt disappointed, I had to recharge battery every 15-  20 minutes after use.

Very slow.So, this LeadPad is nicely made, but it is very slow. I purchased LeapPad academy subscription and there was not a single day when it worked properly. It take too long to open, too long to open and it freezes often.It's a great idea, but poorly executed.My son gets frustrated because he needs to wait for it that long to load.

If I could start over I would buy something else.Bought this because I heard a lot of good things but I'm not impressed with it.  While my four yr old doesn't  notice the screen is slow and lags.  And games for this are expensive ranging from 5 -20 bucks.  That was unexpected nowhere was that in the product description

Super glitchy.I got this for my 3 year old and was happy to see the upgrade to the case from the last model. It is the interface that is the problem.  It sleeps very quickly which disconnects from the internet which the academy portion needs.  The features and very limited games on the tablet are mostly decorative and not of much use, the Learning Academy is the real use.  You have to subscribe separately for a modest fee.  I can live with that, but not when it takes so long to load and crashes every other game.  They need to knock it off with all of the demos ads and sales pushes for over priced games and stream line this to run the learning academy.  If they did that this would be an easy 4 star item.
Did come usb cord..Did not come with usb cord.

Batt runs out quick.Learning games are good for my 3yr old, but the batt run out quick maybe 2 1/2 to 3hrs of consistent play and that's with a full charger and when your dealing with a 3yr old he gets pissed off quick.
Freezes and lags.It lags out and freezes so much that my 3 year old now knows how to force stop apps and reboot. Guess you could say that's very educational.

Essentially a YouTube Tablet - not really education or academic.This was a gift for my 4 year old son and an hour into it he just always ends on up on YouTube. I don't know how to get rid of the YouTube part in the tablet. The support section is not helpful and doesn't actually cover support topics, just directs you to links you need to visits on a different device. The games are not educational and kind of odd. Like after filling in my son's profile they led him to learn about the cardiac system??This will NOT replace actual school and will not act as virtual school. It's literally just a cheap ipad for a kid - if you are looking for more substance I would pass on this!
STOPPED WORKING.My grandson just informed me the LeapPad stopped working. I bought this in May.
Not happy.I'm going to try 1 more time after my return is refunded and maybe that one won't have a broken screen and show a picture unlike the one I just took out of the box.
Won't hold a charge/charger broke..bought these as Xmas gifts for my kids and the chargers have already broke and the tablets don't hold their charge.

Tablet not the best.I’m very disappointed every game you have purchased nothing come with and no to many game optionsI purchased other tablet and much better then this one so I’m very disappointed for this price should come with a bunch of free game
Not for us.My son didn’t care for it and there was nothing on it he would use.  We sent it back and purchased a different one.

Not worth the money.I would not purchase this again. I wish I would’ve known prior to purchasing it. I bought it for my 2 1/2 year old. Nothing is age appropriate for her, and the apps they offer about all cost $20+. You cannot download any outside apps except what they offer. It is a waste of money.

Terminally Underpowered.my 5 year old son and I both love the content on this thing, it really keeps him engaged. the hardware has a lot of trouble keeping up with software, so much so that it's almost unplayable. (and I haven't even downloaded anything yet!) audio and video both consistently lag and stutter and the load times are comparable to 80s PC games on floppy disk (5m, not even joking). really wish there's was a way to fix this =(

Disappointed.My son received the Leapfrog Academy on Leap Pad as a "big brother" gift. He always wanted our phones and we wanted something educational. The tablet comes with a FEW "demo" games but for my 3 year old he only likes 2. From what I can tell you need to buy the monthly academy. I really wish I would've done more researching. I think we needed the Amazon Fire to download what we wanted.

Shockingly  Disappointing.I've been an advocate for LeapFrog products for well over a decade to friends and family. My last child now a toddler was not going to be an exception and we looked forward to giving her the latest version of what LeapFrog had to offer ,the LeapPad Academy Tablet. We got her this for Christmas and I was reallly excited to see what she would be able to make of it as my first two kids , now teens really benefitted from using this in their formative years. Truth be told they had Leapster Explorers and one lasted up till the arrival of the LeapPad.So where is the disappointment you may ask. Well from day one we noticed that the screen proved a bit unreactive at times but we simply put it down to software challenges that work out over time. But naively we were wrong , the problem grew progressively worse to the point where the frustration made my daughter abandon the device. The simplest of strokes wouldn't elicit a response on the screen . Also frustrating has been the WiFi connectivity , its been very inconsistent and drops linkage to the LeapPad academy midgame on a regular basis. In short this turned out to be a nightmare scenario for a bitSome respite came when we switched to run the Leappad Academy from the computer and laptops for her to play the games. She is now rebuilding some desire to play the games as she progresses in a consistent manner using the mouse. She really enjoys the LeapPad Academy and this (initially 3 month free) paid platform  has proven to be  the saving grace. It hasn't assuaged my personal frustration as the whole point of creting an avenue for learning has been disrupted significantly . Which now means I have to acquire a standalone tablet to recreate the experience , or seek out an alternative which defeats the purposeThe two stars are for the software otherwise it would have been much worse.

Software issues.Bought two of them for my grandkids for Christmas.  We had issues with the software freezing so we would reboot and it would work .  Well it will no longer reboot, so we contacted leapfrog to see if they could assist and we were told they no longer have inventory on this tablet and don’t know if they will.

Dropped it Once and done.My son enjoyed it up until he dropped it once accidentally and it has yet to work sense. I fixed it once, when the screen went black, yet you could hear it was still playing. I took the back off and fixed that issue. Then a day later it started freezing and i was sick of him yelling about it so now $100 birthday gift sits there. Not happy with the quality of items that are supposed to be made for kids.

I would pass.I am not impressed with this tablet for multiple reasons. Time based use... this is pointless if you have more than one kid, my 2.5 year old daughter knows to just select her brothers profile when she runs out of time and vice versa. The rubber padding comes off way too easy and is essentially useless. The screen itself is terrible because unless you are directly in front of it, you can't see the screen. The problem with this is if you want to help your kid or see what they are up to, you can't both get a good view... which leads to the other problem if you have more than one kid, they fight over it because they want to watch each other play, but since they can't both see, they end up pulling at it.  Finally with all of those issues, the value is poor due to how expensive the apps are. I am a fan of other leap frog products, but I would stick to a general tablet and free source/better value apps.

Misleading product.Once we received this device, it seemed very modern and sturdy, new and improved since the older version we had. However, the "free" apps were a total joke, not age appropriate for my 2 year old, and not fun. Without a subscription there is literally no option to download more free apps. Everything was for sale $5-25 each, and a subscription is way more than I'd be willing to pay year after year as mu toddler grows up. Save your money and buy a standard tablet with age appropriate apps, that range from free to $5. Put kids mode on. Cheaper and better, no subscription needed.

LENTA Y POCA CALIDAD DEL TÁCTIL!!!.La idea de un tablet educacional está muy buena pero no era lo que esperaba. Se ve fuerte pero sin embargo es súper lenta y el táctil dejó de funcionar en menos de 2 meses que la compré.  No la recomiendo🤷‍♀️

Well ….I am very disappointed. The product information states that the device can be used in French, but it is impossible to set it to French. I tried everywhere on the tablet, and even on the website after creating an account, without success.The quality of the product is there — it is a beautiful educational tablet for children. However, it is extremely disappointing not to be able to use it in French. This is clearly misleading information in the product listing.

Cannot install any app you want.I was under the impression that you could put external apps on this tablet. You can- but only from the Amazon App, not from Google Play Store or other apps. This did not meet my expectations. Leap Frog has great products! But, this one was not a good fit.

Not worth it.Got a used product like many other people have stated in the review. Learning academy does not work for me. I did the free trial and was not able to download any of the apps that come with the paid subscription. Battery life is horrible.I bought this learning tablet because I did not want to get a traditional iPad or tablet where my child could have access to YouTube and more adult things. That’s the only good thing about this learning tablet. It’s not a traditional one where you can access the Internet.But the games and learning activities that come installed are very laggy and could definitely use an upgrade.Would I buy this again? No. Would I recommend it for people to buy? No.
Not worth the money.Charge doesn’t even hold overnight. Keeps disconnecting from wifi. Randomly freezes when playing. Really poor quality product.
Expected a new product..Bought this as a gift, when I opened the package the LeapPad was already opened. Looks like it’s been returned. Disappointing
Already used.When we opened up our leapfrog there was already someone else’s name on the device and a parent lock code that we couldn’t bypass.  We expected a NEW device not a pressed one
Not worth for battery life.Battery runs out too fast

Not Kid Tough.Contrary to its description. This product is not kid tough. The charging port is the weak point and a child doesn’t know to be gentle when grabbing it. Soon it won’t be charging because of the terrible charging port design and it would’ve cost me $150 to get it fixed at a tech repair store.

Does not stand up to the previous Leap pads, very disappointed.Very nice sleek looking device, but not user friendly. The apps are not labeled on the main screen, paid for and downloaded apps and they will not install nor are they showing in the pending downloads. Also Leappad academy is the only new feature and it asks for your credit card information before you can even see what the app is capable of. Paying an extra $40 for what should be an included app after paying $150 for the device is not cool. We will be returning this device. I am beyond disappointed in Leap Frog this time, every other leap frog device was never this much trouble. Parent Buyer beware!
Broken after a month.Have had this for just over a month and it broke. Shut right down and will not start up. Will not charge up. Will not anything. Not happy.
Not intuitive..Not intuitive. Not easy to use.

Disappointed.We have the leapfrog epic which came preloaded with many activities. There is next to nothing preloaded on this. I’ve had it for two days and already spent $35 in the App Store. Wish I bought a tablet.
Do your research.Bought for my 5 year old, somehow put into “safe mode” can’t figure out how to fix, expected to pay for certain things after 3 months. I wish I had bought a different one.

Nice but not tough for kids.My son with autism loves this tablet. I love it for him. The problem is that it seems very fragile. Even with a glass protector he was able to easily break it. These things need to be extra tough especially for special needs people.
Not that great.Ipad itself already expensive then you need subscription which cost more is no good.

Outdated.Hardware and Firmward is outdated. Charge port was an older D style plug. Android 10 operating system is at least 5 versions old. I find the additional applications offered to be pricey. Since the product is a "closed system" only manufactures applications are compatible. The unit felt sturdy enough for a five year old. My granddaughter is android experienced, so she become borred with the unit in one day. Now is sits on the shelf, unwanted.
Leapfrog packaging.Delivery was great.  I bought new but the box is torn up.

NOT COMPATIBLE WITH ABC MOUSE.Bought this because the AI generator said ABC mouse was compatible.  Returning because it is not.  I’m glad I didn’t show them to my kids yet.3 stars because I’m indifferent, I didn’t explore any further.

Good education materials but cheap made.The media could not be loaded.I bought this tablet for my 3 1/2 years old toddler boy.  He likes it and learning from it. He drops it on the floor while trying to turnon the device and the screen cracked and frozen. It should be a drop resistant at least from toddlers height. You better get the warranty 😩

Faulty charging port.I bought this for my son for Christmas it's a great product very educational my only complaint is how it charges i think there's a defect in the charging port, the charger sits so losely in the charging port causing it to lose connection even when plugged in and the charger falls out super easy by barely even touching the tablet and it's not my son's tablet specifically or this particular charger we had to use the warranty and return his first tablet do to an unrelated issue and they both have this problem
Not worth the price.Definitely not worth the price
It was ok.Battery life could have been better but other than that it was good.
Opened and smashed.Boxed nicely and safely, so the packages were destroyed and opened pre shipping.

Not durable.I’ve had 2 leappad screens crack in less than a week even being super careful to take care of them. The durability of the screen is not good. The battery does not last long. It’s a cheaper alternative to an ipad but definitely not a good alternative

Short lifespan.For a while i thought this was the perfect tablet for kids but after a short time the tablet started acting up first not turning on then it simply wouldnt charge at all unless very lucky even then the system would be very messed up and quickly shut back off.  If the tech was in better shape id have givin 5 stars
Microphone doesn't work well.Mostly a good product, however, the microphone is very muffled making the adlib game impossible
Charger Didn’t Fit.Daughter loves the games and the tablet overall but I had to buy another charger to get it turned on because the charger kept flopping out.

la bateria no dura.compre este artículo en mayo del 2024 y el día de hoy su batería dura 30 min , es terrible estar doro el tiempo pagado del conector. a mi hijo le encantan los juegos de este pero lamentablemente su batería no duro nada . terrible

Not kid-proof.Love the concept, but does not hold up to kid use. This is our 3rd time purchasing (I wouldn't bother but it's one of the few things my child on the spectrum gets excited about). The 1st time he dropped it outside and it factory reset and stopped working, this time it fell of the kitchen table, shattered and stopped responding. The warranty only covers if you purchase through leapfrog, so we were s.o.l. Great tablet, but needs to be upgraded to withstand child use.

Not the best but does the job.My 2-year-old loves this tablet. He gets frustrated because it takes forever to load but once he gets going he has a lot of fun. It's durable and the bumpers are great for how rough he gets with his toys sometimes. And it is great for him and I to do activities together. It'll do.I bought this as a gift for my son's fourth birthday. I had driven myself almost crazy reading reviews and trying to decide on the best tablet for him, then finally decided on this one. I ordered a couple months ahead of time, which turned out to be an excellent idea. The first time I ordered this, the item I received had clearly already been opened and returned. The box was dented, retaped in places, and the tablet inside had been put back in upside down. The return process through Amazon was fast, thankfully, and I got the replacement within a few days.Having read other reviews, I made sure to open the tablet and have it all registered and set up before wrapping it for my son's birthday. I also hijacked it and added the Amazon app store using fairly easy instructions I found online, then added some other apps I'd read about and researched. I made sure to download everything I could, since one of the main reasons to buy a tablet like this was for entertainment in the car during an upcoming road trip. It worked great for that, and we took an extra long charger cord for use in the car as well.As to the actual quality of the tablet.... I'd say it's a good starter tablet if your child has never used another tablet before. If your child is used to the speed of a fire or ipad, they'll get frustrated with this one. I get frustrated myself with the length of time it takes to do basic things (ie: turning on). The touchscreen is also not that sensitive, and I find myself having to tap repeatedly to get a simple function to work. I originally set up the time limits to be very conservative but after about a month, maybe 6 weeks, I found myself turning them off completely. My son never met the time limits, much less exceeded them, and having them set was getting irritating. I think the timer count starts as soon as the tablet is woken up for the day? Which is ridiculous. My son would play with it for ten minutes, then come back a few hours later and it would tell him he'd exceeded his time. Which is why we found ourselves constantly overriding it and eventually turned off the limits completely. I did keep the parental controls as far as internet access and the app store because dude will definitely buy himself ALL the Lego apps if he could. Which are ridiculously overpriced, as are all Legos, but that's neither here nor there for this review.The leapfrog app options are ridiculous and I honestly thought there would be more free or cheap ones but there aren't. And my son isn't into any of the characters that seem to be popular on the Leapfrog app store. Which is why I basically rooted the durn thing.The price of this tablet is pretty high compared to what you get (slow speeds, price gouging on apps, etc) and compared to similar tablets elsewhere (my husband bought a renewed fire tablet for $60 that works amazingly great and might be the next tablet we get our son).

Which has the most expensive app prices I have ever seen (taking advantage of a captive audience much?).I bought this as a replacement for a broken android tablet, assuming because it was running android that I would be able to install all the apps my kids have gotten used to. BIG NOPE THERE.TLDR; check the prices of the LeapFrog App Store before you buy, if you like their selection and prices, this is the tablet for you.  If you have already purchased a number of Google Play apps and are looking for a new tablet for your kids, avoid this one.

Kids-ready tablet, but expensive & outdated.I was very excited about this LeapFrog LeapPad tablet for our son to play with. And he does enjoy playing with it. However, for $160 I would only recommend this to someone with no technology inclination whatsoever who wants a ready to go technology toy.Here's why: LeapPad is very easy to set up, comes preloaded with a handful of games and is generally "kid proof" right out of the box.Unfortunately, that's where positives end. The 7" screen is of such poor quality that you have to be looking at it perfectly straight on to avoid distortion. Oh and it's worse in portrait mode than landscape and also worse at higher brightness. The device also runs on top of a very old "neutered" version of Android 4.4. It came out ~6 years ago and Google stopped releasing updates for it (including key *security* updates) almost 5 years ago. Given that this device relies on WiFi connectivity and will likely travel with the child to various WiFi networks (e.g. restaurants, hotels, airports, etc) this device has decent potential to get infected with something nasty and then spread it to other systems. I work in IT Security and a device running Android 4.4 would never be allowed on a corporate network these days.LeapPad does have a web browser and a couple of other regular tablet features in "parent" mode. They are pretty mediocre by today's standards. It also does include a handful of games and they're quite fun but it's pretty clear from using the device that it's really not going to entertain kids for very long and they're really trying to get you to sign up for LeapPad academy ($9.99/mth or a bit less for a yearly subscription).Now, say you accept this cost as the games are quite good. In that case, LeapFrog academy supports a multitude of devices, including Amazon Fire tablets. You can get a new Amazon Fire 7 tablet with a much better screen, dimensions and running a much newer version of Android (7.1 I believe) for $69.99. That $100 you're saving can buy you a super sturdy case for it and almost cover a year of LeapPad academy! And no offense to LeapFrog, but I have a lot of faith in Amazon's application & device security practices. It's going to be much better at being a tablet than LeapPad in every way but is still not running a full version of Android. You can get that full version of Android in a Samsung Galaxy Tab E lite or in a clearance model of a Samsung Galaxy tablet, likely running Android 8 or newer for around $140 - still cheaper than LeapPad. Want to spend even less? Take a look at some well rated "no name" tablets - they can be quite decent.You would then have to set up parental controls on either Amazon Fire or another tablet to make it kid-safe. This is relatively easy to do by following online tutorials but I recognize that this still may be an issue for folks and thus would be the main situation where LeapPad comes out on top.As for me, even though we have this LeapPad already, I don't want it on my Wi-Fi network. I've put it on my guest network for now but we'll likely go down the Amazon Fire 7 route in the future. And I'm thinking that LeapFrog Academy subscription will be worth the money in a few months to get our son to interact with (and learn from) some very well-made educational games!

Great for 4 year old.My daughter was using my tablet before this, but we are trying to teach her better behaviors. So I looked into a more educational tablet and this was perfect. It’s your typical kid tablet so don’t expect too much. You get the academy cheaper with the tablet, the year is your best save. Came with 3 months free! Easy set up and daughter finds it easy to use. Love that it has stylus pen connected to it. If you want more of the unique apps like paw patrol, frozen, you do have to pay extra for them. But remember this should be more for educational anyways. So I got her the academy and the free apps that come with it. The charge does go down even when you’re not playing on it, so just remember to put it on at night when everyone goes to bed.  Sound is loud enough. Easy to carry for her. Cute appearance. She starts 4-K soon so wanted to get her a head start!

Great for three year olds..I got this tablet because my daughter was watching way too many YouTube kids videos and I couldn’t get the parental controls to actually work effectively. (Which if you know, some of the videos on YouTube kids can be kind of weird or encourage behavior you don’t necessarily want your kid to replicate).I think the cost is totally fair, it has a bunch of fun games through the monthly membership which I am comfortable paying for. (Most of the apps my daughter did enjoy on my iPad were a monthly subscription anyway, and again you get more bang for your buck with the leapfrog tablet). It’s super easy to use, my daughter has figured out most of the games herself and really enjoys that it has a music player, books, and puzzle/sticker games. It feels sturdy, which is good because my daughter is fairly clumsy and drops a lot of items without meaning to.The parental controls are awesome. It took forever to download the Amazon App Store. I was able to add Amazon prime video for cartoons, and a few games she enjoyed from the App Store. Kind of difficult to figure out how to get this added, but I’m okay with that as I was looking for a tablet with parental controls that were hard to get around.My review would be five stars if it wasn’t for the battery life. Not sure if it’s because she has games from the Amazon App Store or not, but it does die within 1 day. Not a huge issue as I can just charge it at the end of the night, but it’s advertised to last a few days rather than just the one. The sound quality is also kind of poor, but that’s not a huge issue for my daughter. (Have yet to try it with headphones).Great purchase, though. Would definitely buy again.
